H0.text: when was penicillin first introduced to the public. 1928

H1.text: when was penicillin first introduced to the public. 1930

H2.text: when was penicillin first introduced to the public. 1935

H3.text: when was penicillin first introduced to the public. 1942

A4.text: Penicillin was made available to the general public in the United States on 15 March 1945.

A5.text: After the Second World War Australia was the first country to make the drug available for civilian use.

A6.text: Penicillin Released to Civilians Will Cost $35 Per Patient

A7.text: By 1942, penicillin, produced as pure compound, was still in short supply and not available for clinical use.

A8.text: the development of industrial production technology as well as the mass production and use began during the war

A9.text: Although penicillin was discovered before the war

A10.text: Ernst Chain, Howard Florey, and Edward Abraham succeeded in purifying the first penicillin, penicillin G, in 1942, but it did not become widely available outside the Allied military before 1945.

A11.text: Purified penicillin displayed potent antibacterial activity against a wide range of bacteria and had low toxicity in humans.

A12.text: Alexander Fleming discovered modern-day penicillin in 1928, the widespread use of which proved significantly beneficial during wartime.
